ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: I really liked this course and thought it was well taught. The lectures and lecture slides were very helpful. My only complaint is that, in some of the lab assignments, the instructions were not detailed enough. It would be helpful if the questions were more specific about what should be given in the response.
Great introduction to multiple advanced methods. Some methodologies and interpretations could have been made clearer in the slides.
This is a very good course. The only weakness is that some homework are long, so that there is not enough time for doing the readings.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Fatma Shebl  Very knowledgeable and accessible.

Instructor: Fatma Shebl  Dr. Shebl is an excellent professor. She dominates the topic and follows a very good lesson plan. The use of additional teaching techniques and media may improve the instruction even more.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great applied course to learn advanced methods.
This course is one of the few advanced epidemiology classes in the school. It is taught by an excellent professor and comprises important selected analytical methods not discussed in other classes.
